rules.description: Technology sector contrarian play - sentiment-driven decline with strong fundamentals

outcome.rationale: Historical analysis shows sentiment-driven declines in tech stocks with gross margins above 40% and strong balance sheets represent overreactions 75% of the time

risk_factors: Extended recovery period if fundamentals deteriorate
success_criteria: Financial margins remain stable or improve
New leadership successfully installed within 6 months
rules.context_notes: This rule applies specifically to technology companies in volatile/high-growth sectors where sentiment can dramatically diverge from fundamentals. The pattern suggests markets overweight near-term leadership concerns while underweighting strong business models and competitive moats.

rules.description: Overvaluation scenario - positive sentiment masking weak fundamentals

outcome.rationale: Positive sentiment masking deteriorating fundamentals typically leads to sharp corrections once reality sets in

risk_factors: Liquidity crisis if debt becomes problematic

rules.description: Early warning system - deteriorating metrics before sentiment catches up

outcome.rationale: Slowing growth and margin compression often precede sentiment deterioration by 1-2 quarters

metadata.methodology: Rules derived from backtesting across multiple market cycles, with particular focus on tech sector volatility patterns during leadership transitions and sentiment-driven sell-offs.
